info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 8:13AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS THROUGH THE MID-MORNING HOURS... WEATHER... * A wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain will increase in coverage across areas along and south of the I-94 corridor through the mid-morning hours. Surface temperatures fluctuating near freezing will result in variable precipitation types, with a gradual trend towards sleet and freezing rain by late this morning. * A trace to a tenth or two of snow and sleet accumulation, primarily on grassy surfaces will be possible through 10 AM. A glaze of ice will be possible on untreated roadways, bridges, exit ramps, overpasses, and other untreated surfaces. * Northeast winds through the late morning hours will occasionally gust around 20 mph. * Air temperatures will hover around 32 degrees. IMPACTS... * Light icing in combination with minor snow and sleet accumulation may lead to slippery roads particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Motorists are urged to use caution and account for variable driving conditions by slowing down and allowing extra time. Expect increasingly hazardous travel conditions as the morning progresses. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
